sentences: LaShell Renee Griffin (born January 14, 1968 as LaShell Renee Thomas) is an American gospel musician.
Her first album, Free, was released by Epic Records in 2004.
Griffin was born on January 14, 1968, as LaShell Renee Thomas, to mother Geraldine, whose maiden name was Mundy, and she won Oprah Winfrey's singing competition, Pop Star Challenge.
Griffin and her now deceased former husband, LeVoties Griffin, has five children together, and she still resides with them in Detroit, Michigan.
